pullRequest.title: Implements wild-card searching by fedora_id and pagination.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Implements wild-card searching by fedora_id and pagination.

JIRA Ticket: Resolves: https://jira.lyrasis.org/browse/FCREPO-3307

Other Relevant Links (Mailing list discussion, related pull requests, etc.)

What does this Pull Request do?
This PR implements wildcard search for fedora ids. It also supports the max_results and offset parameters for paging results.
How should this be tested?
# generate some fedora ids:
for i in `seq 1 10`;  do 
    curl -X PUT -u fedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin  "http://localhost:8080/rest/resource-$i";
done;

# all fedora ids
curl -u fedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin "http://localhost:8080/rest/fcr:search?condition=fedora_id%3D*"

# all fedora ids second page of three item page.
curl -u fedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin "http://localhost:8080/rest/fcr:search?condition=fedora_id%3D*&max_results=3&offset=3"

# all fedora ids starting with "resource-1"
curl -u fedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin "http://localhost:8080/rest/fcr:search?condition=fedora_id%3Dresource-1*"

# you can use the full fedora url, ie  "fedora_id=http://localhost:8080/rest/resource-1*"
curl -u fedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin "http://localhost:8080/rest/fcr:search?condition=fedora_id%3Dhttp%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8080%2Frest%2Fresource-1%2A"

# or the internal fedora id: , ie  "fedora_id=info:fedora/resource-1*"
curl -u fedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin "http://localhost:8080/rest/fcr:search?condition=fedora_id%3Dinfo%3Afedora%2Fresource-1%2A"

# or with the preceding slash: , ie  "fedora_id=/resource-1*"
curl -u fedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin "http://localhost:8080/rest/fcr:search?condition=fedora_id=/resource-1*"


Interested parties
Tag (@ mention) interested parties or, if unsure, @fcrepo4/committers

nodes.bodyText: An empty default public constructor is implicit. This can be removed.
An empty default public constructor is implicit. This can be removed.
Additionally, is it invalid for a Fedora ID to start with <, >, or =?

Personally, I think it would be nicer if Fields were constructed with a fromString in a similar way as Operators. Then, callers don't need to care about casing. Not a big deal either way.
Additionally, this would also allow you to make the Field enum names upper case, which is more conventional.

nodes.bodyText: It's not implicit because there's another constructor defined. That said, I can't find the no-arg constructor being used anywhere.
This should be List rather than ArrayList.

Using asserts to validate arguments is not generally considered a good practice. One common approach is something like:
this.items = Preconditions.checkNotNull(items, "items cannot be null");
What if a Fedora ID contains a * as part of its id?
Maybe Condition.toString() should produce a string in this format?
The containment index code was pretty picking about having all table and column names in constants.
I think it's better to use StringBuilder over StringBuffer because StringBuffer is synchronized.
